tweets.html:
I want to create a reality show called "Making Friends" so I can say, "No, that's actually exactly what you're here to do."

— Aisha Muharrar (@eeshmu) July 26, 2011

Little-known fact: Twitter was developed by the military as an instant-alert system for reruns of POOTIE TANG.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) July 26, 2011

Or "Mob Films We Edit & Ruin w/Ads." RT @thesurfreport: AMC's Mob Week should really be called The Al Pacino Film Fest.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 26, 2011

Anti-evolutionists believe God created "The Flintstones" purely to test our faith.

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) July 26, 2011

#Writing tip. Don't be discouraged by other writers' success. Stay focused on the work of sticking pins in dolls of them.

— paul bassett davies (@thewritertype) July 26, 2011

#iamjacksangryhashtag

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 26, 2011

Hey guys, turns out Friday Night Lights actually sucks & #cleareyesfullhearts is lame-o: http://t.co/yjKnYAD (via @cadlymack) #ugh

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) July 26, 2011

@crsbecker To be honest, Oedipus was a *horrible* football player, being blind and all.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) July 26, 2011

@inessentials @JustinFowler @crsbecker "Where is this show's Javert? Where is this show's Leopold Bloom? Where is this show's Godot?"

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) July 26, 2011

@danieltwalters Every show could benefit from a Javert. In fact, that's your next blog post. "5 TV Shows That Need a Javert."

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) July 26, 2011

Your funniest, most profound tweet will be read by 8 million less people than Kim Kardashian's worst tweet about her salad.

— Patrick Walsh (@thepatrickwalsh) July 26, 2011

Daenerys Targaryen needs a Sassy Gay Friend. #gameofthrones

— Ellie Hall (@ellievhall) July 26, 2011

Do we all know enough about each other yet?

— Jason Mustian (@jasonmustian) July 26, 2011

Wow this Franklin & Bash renewal sets a high bar for breaking news coming out of the TCA.

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) July 26, 2011

The only time I wanna hear someone say "totes" is during an NPR pledge drive.

— Alex Baze (@bazecraze) July 26, 2011

Also, even though @sepinwall was convinced he would submit "100," Alec Baldwin submits the #30Rock finale. Carell's to lose.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) July 26, 2011

Also, is Kristen Wiig TRYING to win Jane Lynch another Emmy? She submitted the SNL episode in which Lynch hosted.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) July 26, 2011

Blockbuster Web site now more popular than Netflix! Meanwhile, Blockbuster stores still popular for methheads seeking shelter.

— Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow) July 26, 2011

I am in the same room as Anderson Cooper. I am in the same room as Anderson Cooper. I am in the same room as Anderson Cooper.

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) July 27, 2011

Anderson Cooper Swag: A bag that folds into a smaller bag. Technology is glorious. #TCAs2011

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 27, 2011

How to tell it's Daytime Anderson "I absorb light cuz I'm the palest person on the planet" #TCA @andersoncooper

— Hanhonymous (@Hanhonymous) July 27, 2011

Bummed to be missing @AndersonCooper's press conference. But honestly, not sure his piercing eyes WOULDN'T hypnotize me if in the room! #TCA

— Danielle Turchiano (@danielletbd) July 27, 2011

"She's genius television and she deserves a nightly program," Anderson says of Mariah Carey. #TCAs11

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 27, 2011

Beyond. RT @LJSelsky: Unforgivable MT @andersoncooper sorry I wasn't on #ac360 tonite.

— Mark Joyella (@standupkid) July 27, 2011

Fox (and other nets) want you to wait 8 days to watch free shows online. Pirates have shows up < hour after air http://bit.ly/odvjQy

— Peter Kafka (@pkafka) July 27, 2011

For years we've been able to log onto Hulu or Fox.com each morning & watch what we missed on TV the night before. That's gonna get harder...

— Brian Stelter (@brianstelter) July 26, 2011

Here's a really tricky way to watch new Fox shows for free: Get an antenna.

— Ben Fritz (@benfritz) July 27, 2011

It does occur to me that it's not unusual for shows to sit on my DVR for 8 days (per @mikejstein)

— Ben Fritz (@benfritz) July 27, 2011

If I'm ever in the same room as Katherine Heigl I'm leaving.

— Annie Stamell (@stamos) July 27, 2011

"It's too bad. I totally would have had a threesome with you guys" <-- How we will remember Entourage.

— Cory Barker (@corybarker) July 27, 2011

@corybarker Um. Nope. That is not how I will remember Entourage

— Noel Kirkpatrick (@noelrk) July 27, 2011

tweets.author_name: Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There
tweets.html:
why oh why did I capture clips from JERSEY SHORE S3 when they were on MTV's website last month? I am now at Blockbuster's mercy.

— Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There (@AmandaAnnKlein) July 27, 2011

Ok. You get drunk- fall asleep at a party in Hollywood. next day, she's pregnant.
Who do you want to get pregnant by? Guys... Impregnate?

— ABFoundation (@ABFalecbaldwin) July 26, 2011

Is Alec Baldwin asking Twitter which star they'd like to get sleep-raped by?

— Stephen Falk (@stephenfalk) July 26, 2011

Apparently @AlecBaldwin thought all "Do/Dump/Marry" needed was a little rapey-ness.

— Irin Carmon (@irin) July 26, 2011

My pregnancy quiz was channeling Tracy. But hey, no more jokes on Twitter. Certainly not worth it.

— ABFoundation (@ABFalecbaldwin) July 27, 2011

tweets.author_name: Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There
tweets.html:
I suppose I deserve this for doing a conference paper on JERSEY SHORE. It's Karma. And Karma. (That was a JERSEY SHORE joke folks).

— Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There (@AmandaAnnKlein) July 27, 2011

Network news, oy. MT @ABCWorldNews What's the saddest movie you've ever watched? The Titanic? Tune in tonight to find out what people voted!

— Nancy Franklin (@nancyfranklin) July 26, 2011

I am hoping @m_giacchino is really Michael Giacchino. I can't wait to hear his "Hashtag Theme."

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 27, 2011

Trending in Chicago right now: "Kenan & Kel" "Teen Nick" and "Clarissa." Um, I sort of want cable right now.

— Kristen (@Kpengell) July 27, 2011

Kenan & Kel is trending. Is it 1996 already?

— Justin Stangel (@Justin_Stangel) July 27, 2011

Corporations should want marijuana to be legal because then who would remember to fast-forward through their commercials?

— Alex Baze (@bazecraze) July 27, 2011

#SwitchedAtBirth was a total heartbreaker this week. They've just been churning out episode after episode of amazing TV. Summer fave by far.

— Ilana (@ITveee) July 27, 2011

Also, I'm so in love w Sean Berdy I may have just pretended to be 15 so that I could vote for him in the Teen Choice Awards #SwitchedAtBirth

— Ilana (@ITveee) July 27, 2011

@ITveee I agree with everything you just tweeted. the show was AMAZING last night & I am doodling Sean Berdy's name all over my notebook.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) July 27, 2011

Apparently @Steven_Moffat went to the Joss Whedon School of Making Terrible Shit Happen To Beloved Characters. End of #Series5. #DoctorWho

— Tim (@rural_juror) July 27, 2011

My mom is watching A. Seyfried's Red Ridin Hood. This is as disturbing to me as the bot who hacked my Twitter & posted some wack ass ads.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) July 27, 2011

Went on a Ferris Wheel this weekend which did not break down at the top. Has TV lied to me?

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) July 27, 2011

Every time I read about an actor getting an honorary doctorate I am so annoyed that I didn't go THAT route. HONORARY PhD! *smacks forehead*

— Susana Santos Martins (@smartins70) July 27, 2011

I bet Garry Marshall directing something is a lot like Garry Marshall yelling at a pharmacist and then falling asleep at the pharmacy.

— bobby finger (@bobbyfinger) July 27, 2011

Every time an AMC showrunner is in the headlines for some behind-the-scenes drama is an opportunity to appreciate Vince Gilligan even more

— Jason Mittell (@jmittell) July 27, 2011

Darabont + Walking Dead = Using Reeses' Peanut Butter Cups to marinade a bloody New York Strip. Both good on their own, bad when combined.

— Drew Morton (@thecinemadoctor) July 27, 2011

Woof! I guess the title actually refers to the writer's room. #thewalkingdead

— Wil Zmak (@wilzmak) July 27, 2011

SUUUUD!!!! RT @smartyjpayne: Fans are enraged when finale reveals apocalypse a red herring the whole time, masterminded by lovable Dale

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) July 27, 2011

It's a holistic journey through the zombie apocalypse, Ryan. RT @TVMcGee: Veena's taking over, isn't she? #TheKillingDead

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) July 27, 2011

@sepinwall @TvMcGee Fans enraged when finale reveals apocalypse a red herring the whole time, masterminded by lovable Dale #TheKillingDead

— Cory Payne (@smartyjpayne) July 27, 2011

@sepinwall Zombie Rosie Larson comes back from the dead to catch her real killer. #TheKillingDead

— Tommy Ortega [Blue Check Mark] (@TMO_NYC) July 27, 2011

I like to think Frank Darabont escaped the Walking Dead writers room by crawling a mile through a sewer pipe, to emerge cheering in the rain

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) July 27, 2011

The fact that my tivo is stockpiling episodes of Entourage and I can't bring myself to delete them may mean it's time for professional help.

— Ilana (@ITveee) July 27, 2011

I bet Daniel Tosh was an incredibly successful bully in high school.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) July 27, 2011

As it turns out, if you're looking for something to watch to help you fall asleep, #BreakingBad is the worst fucking option.

— Zach (@zhaldeman) July 27, 2011
